errors.error_description: The command `pip install -r requirements-dev.txt` is executed before activating the virtual environment, causing dependencies to be installed globally instead of within the isolated environment.
correction_candidates: Move `pip install -r requirements-dev.txt` to after the `source .venv/bin/activate` command.
Replace `pip install -r requirements-dev.txt` with `python -m pip install -r requirements-dev.txt`.
Remove the `python -m venv .venv` command and install dependencies globally.
Add `sudo` before `pip install -r requirements-dev.txt` to ensure correct permissions.
errors.golden_answer: Move `pip install -r requirements-dev.txt` to after the `source .venv/bin/activate` command.

errors.error_description: The command to run unittests, `python unittest`, is syntactically incorrect. It should use the `-m` flag to execute the `unittest` module.
Added unnecessary dependencies beautifulsoup4 and lxml to the installation command
Incorrect order in the For Devs section - pip install requirements before activating virtual environment
correction_candidates: git clone git@github.com:hhursev/recipe-scrapers.git && cd recipe-scrapers && python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && python -m pip install --upgrade pip && pip install -r requirements-dev.txt && pip install pre-commit && pre-commit install && python -m unittest
